intro: Sciadotenia campestris, commonly known as the field sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. Sciadotenia campestris is often used in traditional medicine and has potential applications in modern pharmacology.
